user_profile: You are a married parent in your late 40s living in Austin, TX, with two teenaged children (13 and 16). Your family bonds over movies—parents lean toward sci‑fi, clever comedies, and well-reviewed indies, while the kids like superhero films, anime, and feel‑good adventures. You try to keep things PG-13 or below, avoiding heavy gore or explicit content. You prefer streaming to keep costs down but will splurge on an Alamo Drafthouse outing for special releases. You host Friday family movie nights with themed snacks and like to check reviews and parental guides before deciding.
task_description: Help the user plan a family movie night: recommend a mix of one recent release and one classic that will appeal to both parents and teens (13 and 16), confirm where each title is available to stream or showtimes in Austin, and note any key content considerations.
first_user_prompt: We’re planning a movie night with our 13-year-old and 16-year-old this weekend. Could you suggest a newer release and a classic we’ll all enjoy and tell me where to stream them in the US? Please flag anything that might be too intense.
